isis.stitle: Recall 00504 - Eaton AutoShift II Transmissions in Vehicles Built 06/01/1999 Through 4/20/2000

recall.subject: Eaton AutoShift II Transmissions in Vehicles Built 06/01/1999 Through 4/20/2000

defect.para: This is a software defect that can cause the transmission to be in the forward second gear rather than the reverse gear when reverse is selected by the operator. In other words, this would be an incorrect gear engagement causing the vehicle to move in an unintended direction. If the vehicle is in the forward second gear when the reverse gear was selected by the operator the vehicle may be involved in an accident which may result in property damage, personal injury, or death.
A new start date for the build date window resulted in an increase in the number of vehicles in this campaign. Please perform the following steps to clearly document this change.

item.para: Change the start date of the build date range on your copy of the original G-00504 letter dated June, 2000 from 1/10/2000 to 6/1/1999. This date change is required in only two places in the original G-00504 dealer mailing. The first location is on the first page in the SUBJECT. The second place the date should be changed is in the first page of the customer letter.
Refer to the original G-00504 letter (below) for Parts, Labor, Warranty and Service information.
Attach this letter to the original G-00504 letter dated June, 2000.
If you do not have the original G-00504 letter, a copy can be ordered by calling 616-968-4856 or printing one from the International web site.

ownernote.para: International Truck and Engine Corporation will notify owners of this campaign on their vehicles. During the recall process, a listing of owner names and addresses will be furnished to the involved dealers to enable dealers to follow up with owners and have the vehicles corrected. You must limit the use of this listing to this campaign since the list may contain information obtained from state motor vehicle registration records and the use of such motor vehicle registration data for purposes other than this campaign is a violation of law in several states.

svcproc.title: EZ-Tech ServiceRanger Setup

svcprocinfo.para: To perform this programming you must have the Eaton ServiceRanger software installed on your EZ-tech service tool. The ServiceRanger software and instructions have been mailed to all dealers in the US and Canada. If you have not received your software package by mail call the Eaton ServiceRanger support toll free at 1-888-880-0970.
The processes below outline the procedure for updating AutoShift Generation II transmission software. More details on using this software can be found in the ServiceRanger Users Guide.
A NavPPP connection will be required to get product programming software from Eaton. The NavPPP connection is only required for the "Getting Product Software" phase.

svcsubproc.title: A) Obtaining an Eaton USER ID
svcsubproc.para: An Eaton USER ID is required for downloading product software and ServiceRanger updates.
There are two ways to obtain an Eaton USER ID. The first way is to call Eaton ServiceRanger support toll free at 1-888-880-0970 and select option 5.
The second way is to use the Eaton web-site. To access this web site perform the following steps.

step1.para: Double click on the Vehicle Diagnostics folder.
Double click on the NavPPP icon and dial-up International as you usually would. For details on using NavPPP see the section titled "How to Use NavPPP" after this procedure.
Double click on the ServiceRanger icon. This is located in the Vehicle Diagnostics folder.
Click on the Internet Download button from the main menu.

Click the ServiceRanger Main Menu button to open the ServiceRanger Internet home page. Please note that Internet Explorer 4.0 or 5.0 is required. If you have Internet Explorer 3.0 then the page will come up in error.

Click on the REGISTRATION Button at the top the ServiceRanger web-site and fill out the form that appears. Once the form is complete, click on the Submit Button at the bottom of the form. Note that it is recommended that you use your DYYxxxx id for the user name and Password of ServiceRanger.
When the form is submitted, the ServiceRanger administrator will send an e-mail confirming your user name and password within 2 days.
Once complete, you may exit the ServiceRanger Web Page.

svcsubproc.title: B) Authorizing Your EZ-Tech
svcsubproc.para: Please note that you cannot authorize your PC until you have received an Eaton USER ID and password from the steps above.

item.para: Double click on the Vehicle Diagnostics folder.
Double click on the NavPPP icon and dialup International as you usually would. For details on using NavPPP see the section titled "How to Use NavPPP" after this procedure.
Double click on the ServiceRanger icon. This is located in the Vehicle Diagnostics folder.
Click on the Internet Downloads button.
Click the ServiceRanger Main Menu button to open the ServiceRanger Internet home page.
Click on the Authorize PC button at the top of the page. You will be asked for the ServiceRanger USER ID and password that was created above.
Once complete, you may exit the ServiceRanger Web Page.

svcproc.stitle: Recall 00504 - Eaton AutoShift II Transmissions in Vehicles Built 06/01/1999 Through 4/20/2000
svcproc.title: AutoShift Application Product Downloads

svcprocinfo.para: There are three phases in creating an AutoShift Product Download. The three phases are 1) Getting AutoShift Product Information, 2) Getting AutoShift Product Software, and 3) Downloading AutoShift Product Software. Only downloading application software will be discussed here. For configuration download information please refer to the ServiceRanger Users Guide.

step1.para: Connect the EZ-Tech PC to the vehicle using Navistar communications interface cable (part number ZTSE4444A).
Double click on the Vehicle Diagnostics folder. Double click on the ServiceRanger icon.
Click on the Product Download button. When a vehicle is equipped with multiple Eaton products a Product Selection screen will appear. Select the AutoShift AS2 product and click the OK button.

If vehicle information is not available, you will be asked to enter it, the information that must be entered is VIN, Transmission Serial Number, and Mileage. Once the information is typed in, click on the OK button.
The Product Download Screen will then appear showing the vehicle information and software available.

If the Application software is available for the AutoShift you are working on, it will automatically appear on the available applications download section of the screen. You may proceed to download software if the application software numbers are greater than: Shift Control: 742; Transmission Control: 066. These numbers will be in the application download name. If no software is available you will need to exit the Product Download screen and go to the next step Getting AutoShift Product Software below.
Once the screen is shown, if no application is shown, close the product download screen and go to Getting AutoShift Product Software.

svcsubproc.title: Getting AutoShift Product Software
svcsubproc.para: The Internet download button allows for retrieval of AutoShift Product Software from the NavPPP connection. Once you have opened the Internet download screen, the information at the top of the screen is where product groups are selected for software retrieval. Product groups are vehicles that are programmed the same at the factory. Select the group containing the vehicle being programmed, and the ServiceRanger server will provide a list of available software for that product. Select the application software and then download it onto your EZ-Tech.

step1.para: Double click on the Vehicle Diagnostics folder. Double click on the NavPPP icon and dialup International.
Click on the Internet download button from the ServiceRanger Main Menu.

Select the product group by double clicking on the desired product group. The Product Group will contain the vehicle information, which was input in the Retrieve Product Information process. This will connect to the ServiceRanger web-site and provide the software that is currently available for this product group.
A screen will open, asking for the user name and password. This is the USER ID and password obtained in the registration process above.

The ServiceRanger web page will open showing available software. The application software is shown in blue on the top of the screen. Select the Software that has a name similar to "RTO-xx710x-AS2 070 and 043" by clicking on the radio button to the right of the name. DO NOT USE THE "LEVER" SOFTWARE (for example RTO-XX710X-A52 shift lever 070).
Click on the SELECT CONFIGURATION button. This will take you to the select quantity screen.

To select the number of downloads that will be available for downloading to a product, click in the drop down box after the software name. When the desired number of downloads have been selected, click on the Purchase Configuration button.

The next screen provides a summary of the product software requested in the previous screens. If correct, click on the Confirm Purchase button. If the configuration is not correct, then close WebRanger window and start Getting AutoShift Product Software from the beginning.

To download the selected software to the EZ-Tech's hard drive, click on CLICK HERE TO DOWNLOAD. A status window will appear, showing progress of the download. A window will be displayed when the download has finished. Click the OK button to return to the Internet main menu, then close the Internet download screen.

svcsubproc.title: Downloading AutoShift Product Software
svcsubproc.para: This procedure will actually download the product software into the AutoShift transmission.

step1.para: Connect the EZ-Tech PC to the vehicle using International communications interface cable (part number ZTSE4444A).
Click on the Product Download button. When a vehicle is equipped with multiple Eaton products a PRODUCT SELECTION screen will appear. Select the AutoShift AS2 product and click the OK button.

If vehicle information is not available, you will be asked to enter it. The information that must be entered is VIN, Transmission Serial Number, and Mileage. Once the information is typed in, click on the OK button.
The Product Download Screen will then appear showing vehicle information and software available.

The Application software appears on the available applications download section of the screen. You may proceed to download software if the application software numbers are greater than: Shift Control: 742; Transmission Control: 066. Note: these numbers will be in the application download name. If an application is not provided for one of the controllers, it already has the latest software. You may confirm this by double clicking on the view configuration button. The software numbers should be greater than the numbers above.

Start download by double clicking on the software part number. Both the transmission and shift control will require downloading using the same step. Start by clicking on the software which contains the word "Shift Control" in the name.

ServiceRanger will prepare the transmission for downloading and prompt you to turn the ignition key to the off position. When the key is in the off position click on the OK button. ServiceRanger will start to download and will indicate the download progress with the status bar at the bottom of the screen. It should be noted that once a download is begun it cannot be canceled. The user must wait for the download to be completed.

Once download is complete, ServiceRanger will request the ignition key be turned back on and update the product information. Once information is updated, start transmission download by clicking on the software with the words "Trans Controller" in the name. Once the download is complete. Turn the ignition back on to update vehicle information.

The download is now complete. To confirm download click on View Current configuration button and confirm the Shift Control software is greater than 742 and the transmission controller is greater than 066.
The ServiceRanger program can be closed or you may close the product download screen and move to another vehicle.

svcproc.title: How to Use NavPPP
svcproc.para: To manually start Dial-Up Networking open the Vehicle Diagnostics folder on the Desktop, and click on the NavPPP icon.
When the NavPPP icon is launched, the following screen will come up.

figure.caption: First Screen When NavPPP is Launched

svcproc.para: Make sure that the phone number is correct (does the current location require a 9 to be dialed first?).

Next, click the Connect button to start the connection process. If the connection is made properly, the following screen will come up. It may take a minute or so to make the connection and you will see a screen like this.

figure.caption: Screen Shown When Connection is Made

svcproc.para: Key in your ID, hit the enter key, and you will be prompted for your password. Type in your password and hit the enter key.
You will then see a menu like this.
IP address is "dynamic - it may be different the next time you log in"

You must make a choice! If you type 1, hit enter and hit F7 or click on the Continue (F7) button you will connect to the Navistar Network. If you type 1, hit enter and don't hit F7 or click Continue (F7) you will see a screen like Figure 14, the Gateway will time out in about two minutes, disconnect and return you to the Connect To screen as in Figure 15. Start over.

If you hit F7 without making a choice from the menu the Gateway will be unable to negotiate what you are trying to do and an error box will be displayed as in Figure 16. Once you have clicked on OK you will be returned to the Connect To dialog box. Start over.
If you type 2 and hit enter you will be prompted to type in your old password, your new password and to re-enter your new password as in Figure 17.
The menu will again be displayed. Make a choice and hit F7 or click on the Continue (F7) button.
If, when you key in your password you see that your password has expired you will be prompted to enter a new password as in Figure 18.

Be very careful to note if your "Caps Lock" is 'ON' when you type in your new password.
You will then be prompted to re-enter your new password. After it verifies your new password you will be prompted to login again. Make sure you use your new password when prompted. Make your choice from the menu. Again, be sure you hit F7 or click on Continue.

When you key in your password, you see that your password has expired, you enter a new password , re-type it, and if they don't match you will see a screen like Figure 19. Type it in again and then re-enter it.

If you accidentally type in the wrong ID and/or password you will see the message - ** Bad Password - and Login: will again be displayed as in Figure 20. Re-type your ID and password and follow the menu.

para.emph: It is STRONGLY advised not to use a script or a batch file to connect to NavNet for several reasons. You will never see the menu, you will never see when your password expires, and you won't be able to change your password when you want to if you use a script. Please use this guide when connecting to NavNet. If your screens don't look like they do in this guide chances are you are using a script to connect to NavNet. If you call the Dealer Support Hotline you can receive instructions on how to correctly connect to NavNet.
System 21 or EZ Tech Technical support is available through Fieldworks by calling International toll free at 1-800-527-7879.

partsinfo.para: No parts are required for this recall. However, if you did not receive your programming software package by mail please call Eaton ServiceRanger support toll free at 1-888-880-0970.

responuscan.para:
Proceed immediately to make necessary correction to units in inventory. All inventory vehicles subject to this recall campaign must be corrected prior to sale, transfer or delivery.
If vehicles have been sold or transferred and you are in receipt of Customer Notification Letters and Authorization for Recall Service cards for those vehicles, transfer location or customer must be notified IMMEDIATELY from your dealer location.
Dealers must correct all vehicles subject to this campaign at no charge to the owner, regardless of mileage, age of vehicle, or ownership, from this time forward.

The National Traffic and Motor Vehicle Safety Act, as amended, provides that each vehicle that is subject to a vehicle recall campaign must be adequately repaired within a reasonable time after the owner has tendered it for repair. A failure to adequately repair within 60 days after a tender of a vehicle is prima facie evidence of failure to repair within a reasonable time. If the condition is not adequately repaired within 60 days, the owner may be entitled to replacement with an identical or reasonable equivalent vehicle at no charge, or to a refund of the purchase price less a reasonable allowance for depreciation.
However, consistent with the customer notification, dealers are expected to complete the repairs on the mutually agreed upon service date.

In order to avoid having to replace an owner vehicle or refund the purchase price, every effort must be made to promptly schedule an appointment with each owner to repair his or her vehicle as soon as possible.
